page.title: 14COMMUNICATION
page.content: The A6 runs north and south through the valley to{Buxton and Derby}an the A623 climbs the eastern escarpment to cross the moors to{Chesterfield. To the south east, the A615 leads to {Alfreton }and the industrial areas of the {North-East Derbyshire Coalfield.} A single-track railway also follows the river valley from Derby as far as Matlock Station. Matlock is the administrative centre for the county of Derbyshire . Farming, forestry, hosiery, tourism and service industries provide most of the employment for people living in the town and also for commuters from the surrounding areas.
